tool.name: Run IMa3

param.name: np
param.label: Number of processors to run in parallel (Max. 8)

param.name: l
param.label: Number of genealogies to save post burn-in

param.name: d
param.label: Number of steps between genealogy saving (MCMC mode only)(default 100)

param.name: p
param.label: Output options
param.option: 0 Turn off trend plots in outfile (default is to print trend plots)
1 Turn off plots of marginal curves in outfile (default is to print marginal density plots)
2 Print TMRCA histogram for each genealogy (MCMC mode only)
3 Print histogram of splitting times divided by prior (do not use with -j0 or when only 2 sampled populations
5 Print pairwise probabilities that one parameter is greater than another
6 Print estimates and histograms of population migration rate
7 Print joint estimate for splitting times (MCMC mode only, for models with 3, 4 or 5 populations)

param.name: r
param.label: Run options
param.option: 1 Do not save genealogies to a file (default saves sampled genealogies)
2 Save the state of the Markov chain in a file - named with extension .mcf (MCMC mode only)
4 Write all mutation related updates rates to stdout during the run (default is to suppress this)
5 Print burntrend file at end of burnin period; use with -b followed by integer (MCMC mode only)

param.name: z
param.label: Number of steps between screen output (default is 10000) (MCMC mode only)

tool.help: **IMa3** is a parallel implementation of IMa3, using OpenMPI-C++ - a Bayesian MCMC based method for inferring population demography under the IM (Isolation with Migration) model.
